inferno.neural.functional.adaptive_leaky_integrate_and_fire#

adaptive_leaky_integrate_and_fire(inputs: Tensor, voltages: Tensor, refracs: Tensor, adaptations: Tensor, *, step_time: float | Tensor, rest_v: float | Tensor, reset_v: float | Tensor, eq_thresh_v: float | Tensor, refrac_ts: int | Tensor, tc_membrane: float | Tensor, tc_adaptation: float | Tensor, spike_adapt_increment: float | Tensor, resistance: float | Tensor = 1.0, lock_voltage_on_refrac: bool = True, lock_adaptation_on_refrac: bool = True, update_adaptations: bool = True) → tuple[Tensor, Tensor, Tensor, Tensor][source]#

Runs a simulation step of adaptive leaky integrate-and-fire (ALIF) dynamics.

ALIF is implemented as a step of leaky integrate-and-fire applying existing adaptations, using linear spike-dependent adaptive thresholds, then updating those adaptations for the next timestep.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} V_m(t + \Delta t) &= \left[V_m(t) - V_\mathrm{rest} - R_mI(t)\right] \exp\left(-\frac{t}{\tau_m}\right) + V_\mathrm{rest} + R_mI(t) \\ \Theta(t) &= \Theta_\infty + \sum_k \theta_k(t) \\ \theta_k(t + \Delta t) &= \theta_k(t) \exp\left(-\frac{\Delta t}{\tau_k}\right) \end{align*}\end{split}\]

If a spike was generated at time \(t\), then.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align*} V_m(t) &\leftarrow V_\mathrm{reset} \\ \theta_k(t) &\leftarrow \theta_k(t) + a_k \end{align*}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

  • inputs (torch.Tensor) – presynaptic currents, \(I(t)\), in \(\mathrm{nA}\).

  • voltages (torch.Tensor) – voltage across the cell membrane, \(V_m(t)\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • refracs (torch.Tensor) – number of remaining simulation steps to exit refractory periods.

  • adaptations (torch.Tensor) – last adaptations applied to membrane voltage threshold, \(\theta_k\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • step_time (float | torch.Tensor) – length of a simulation time step, \(\Delta t\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • rest_v (float | torch.Tensor) – membrane potential difference at equilibrium, \(V_\mathrm{rest}\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • reset_v (float | torch.Tensor) – membrane voltage after an action potential is generated, \(V_\mathrm{reset}\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • eq_thresh_v (float | torch.Tensor) – equilibrium of the firing threshold, \(\Theta_\infty$\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • refrac_ts (int | torch.Tensor) – number of time steps the absolute refractory period lasts.

  • tc_membrane (float | torch.Tensor) – time constant of exponential decay for membrane voltage, \(\tau_m\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • tc_adaptation (float | torch.Tensor) – time constant of exponential decay for threshold adaptations, \(\tau_k\), in \(\mathrm{ms}\).

  • spike_adapt_increment (float | torch.Tensor) – amount by which the adaptive threshold is increased after a spike, \(a_k\), in \(\mathrm{mV}\).

  • resistance (float | torch.Tensor, optional) – resistance across the cell membrane, \(R_m\), in \(\mathrm{M\Omega}\). Defaults to 1.0.

  • lock_voltage_on_refrac (bool, optional) – if membrane voltages should be fixed while in the refractory period. Defaults to True.

  • lock_adaptation_on_refrac (bool, optional) – if adaptations not triggered by spikes should be fixed while in the refractory period. Defaults to True.

  • update_adaptations (bool, optional) – if adaptations should be updated. Defaults to True.

Returns:

tuple containing output and updated state:

spikes: which neurons generated an action potential.

voltages: updated membrane voltage.

refracs: updated number of remaining simulation steps to exit refractory periods.

adaptations: updated adaptations for membrane voltage thresholds.

Return type:

tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]

Shape:

inputs, voltages, and refracs: \([B] \times N_0 \times \cdots\), where the batch dimension \(B\) is optional.

adaptations: \(N_0 \times \cdots \times k\), each slice along the last dimension should be shaped like the neuron group to which the adaptation is being applied, where \(k\) is the number of parameter tuples.

step_time, rest_v, reset_v, thresh_v, refrac_ts, tc_membrane, resistance: broadcastable with inputs, voltages, refracs.

tc_adaptation and spike_adapt_increment: broadcastable with adaptations.

outputs (except adaptations): same shape as inputs, voltages, and refracs.

outputs (adaptations): \([B] \times N_0 \times \cdots \times k\), where the batch dimension \(B\) is dependent on inputs.

Note

This function doesn’t automatically reduce resultant adaptations along the batch dimension, this should generally be done by averaging along the \(0^\mathrm{th}\) (batch) dimension.

Note

If update_adaptations is false, then returned adaptations will not have a leading batch dimension.

Note

For more details and references, visit Adaptive Leaky Integrate-and-Fire (ALIF) in the zoo.
